translated: who were endowed with all pure qualities, surrounded and revered.

original: puraskṛto dharmaṃ deśayati sma /
analyzed: puraskṛtaḥ dharmam deśayati sma

original: upaśāntendriya upaśāntamānaso bahupoṣyo bahuputro bahuduhitṛko bahubhṛtyaparijanasampannaḥ śrāddho mahāśrāddhaḥ kalyāṇāśayaḥ yena bhagavāṃstenopasaṃkrāntaḥ

translated: who was of tranquil senses and mind, who had many disciples, many sons, many daughters, and many servants and attendants, who was faithful, very faithful, and had a virtuous intention. He approached the Blessed One,

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya bhagavantaṃ anekaśatasahasrapradakṣaṇīkṛtyaikānte nyaṣīdat /

translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One many hundreds of thousands of times, and sat to one side.

original: ekānte niṣaṇṇaśca sucandro gṛhapatirlabdhāvasaro bhagavantametadavocat /
analyzed: ekānte niṣaṇṇaḥ ca sucandraḥ gṛhapatiḥ labdha avasaraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: While sitting to one side, the householder Sucandra, having obtained the opportunity, said this to the Blessed One:

original: pṛccheyamahaṃ bhagavantaṃ tathāgataṃ arhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ kiñcit pradeśaṃ sacet me bhagavānavakāśaṃ kuryāt pṛṣṭapraśnavyākaraṇāya /
analyzed: pṛccheyam aham bhagavantam tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham kiñcid pradeśam saced me bhagavān avakāśam kuryāt pṛṣṭa praśna vyākaraṇāya
translated: I would ask the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, about a certain point, if the Blessed One would grant me the opportunity to put a question and answer it.

original: evamukte bhagavān sucandraṃ gṛhapatimetadavocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān sucandram gṛhapatim etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to the householder Sucandra:

original: pṛccha tvaṃ gṛhapate yadyadevākāṃkṣasi /
analyzed: pṛccha tvam gṛhapate yat yat eva ākāṃkṣasi
translated: Ask, householder, whatever you wish.

original: ahaṃ te yathāpraśnavyākaraṇāya cittamārādhayiṣye /
analyzed: aham te yathā praśna vyākaraṇāya cittam ārādhayiṣye
translated: I will gratify your mind by answering the question as it is asked.

analyzed: evam ukte sucandraḥ gṛhapatiḥ sādhu bhagavan iti kṛtvā bhagavataḥ pratiśrutya bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the householder Sucandra, saying Very well, Blessed One, and promising to the Blessed One, said this to the Blessed One:

original: kathaṃ bhagavan kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā daridro bhūtvā adaridro bhavati vyādhitaśca bhūtvā avyādhito bhavati /

translated: How, Blessed One, does a son of good family or a daughter of good family, having become poor, become not poor, and having become sick, become not sick?

original: atha khalu bhagavān jānanneva sucandraṃ gṛhapatimetadavocat /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān jānan eva sucandram gṛhapatim etat avocat
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing full well, said this to the householder Sucandra:

original: kimiti tvaṃ gṛhapate daridratāyāḥ paripraśnaṃ pṛcchasi evamukte gṛhapatirbhagavantaṃ etadavocat /
analyzed: kim iti tvam gṛhapate daridra tāyāḥ paripraśnam pṛcchasi evam ukte gṛhapatiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Householder, why do you ask about poverty? When this was said, the householder said this to the Blessed One:

original: daridro 'haṃ bhagavan daridro 'haṃ sugata bahupoṣyo bahuputro bahuduhitṛko bahubhṛtyaparijanasaṃpannaśca /
analyzed: daridraḥ ham bhagavan daridraḥ ham sugata bahu poṣyaḥ bahu putraḥ bahu duhitṛkaḥ bahu bhṛtya parijana saṃpannaḥ ca

original: taddarśayatu bhagavāṃstādṛśaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ yena daridrāḥ sattvāḥ adaridrāḥ bhaveyuḥ
analyzed: tat darśayatu bhagavān tādṛśam dharmaparyāyam yena daridrāḥ sattvāḥ a daridrāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Therefore, may the Blessed One teach such a Dharma discourse by which poor beings may become non-poor,

original: vyādhitāśca sattvā avyādhitā bhaveyuḥ bahudhanadhānyakośakoṣṭāgārasampannāśca bhaveyuḥ

original: priyā manāpāśca manojñāḥ saṃdarśanīyāśca bhaveyuḥ dānapatayo mahādānapatayaśca akṣīṇahiraṇyasuvarṇadhanadhānyaratnakośakoṣṭāgārāśca bhaveyuḥ

translated: and may they be dear, pleasing, attractive, and delightful to see, and may they be givers, great givers, and may they have inexhaustible gold, silver, wealth, grain, jewels, treasuries, storehouses, and granaries,

original: maṇimuktāvaiḍūryavajraśaṅkhaśilāpravālajātarūparajatasamṛddhāśca bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: maṇi muktā vaiḍūrya vajra śaṅkha śilā pravāla jātarūpa rajata samṛddhāḥ ca bhaveyuḥ
translated: and may they be endowed with jewels, pearls, lapis lazuli, diamonds, conch shells, quartz, coral, refined gold, and silver.

original: supratiṣṭhitasusamṛddhagṛhaputradārakuṭumbāśca bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: su pratiṣṭhita su samṛddha gṛha putra dāra kuṭumbāḥ ca bhaveyuḥ
translated: May they have well-established and prosperous homes, sons, wives, and families.

original: evamukte bhagavān sucandragṛhapatimetadavocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān sucandra gṛhapatim etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to the householder Sucandra:

translated: Go, Ānanda, to the house of the householder Sucandra and see if it is completely filled with all wealth, grain, silver, gold, jewels, and all implements, and if the great treasuries and storehouses are completely full.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān ānaṃdo bhagavataḥ pratiśrutya yena kośāmbīmahānagarī yena sucandrasya gṛhapateragāraṃ tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /

translated: Then the venerable Ānanda, having assented to the Blessed One, went to the great city of Kośalā, to the house of the householder Sucandra.

original: upasaṃkramyābhyantaraṃ praviśyādrākṣīt tat paripūrṇaṃ sarvadhanadhānyahiraṇyasuvarṇaiḥ sarvopakaraṇaiśca Vdh
analyzed: upasaṃkramya abhyantaram praviśya adrākṣīt tat paripūrṇam sarva dhana dhānya hiraṇya suvarṇaiḥ sarva upakaraṇaiḥ ca
translated: Having approached and entered inside, he saw that it was completely filled with all wealth, grain, silver, gold, jewels, and all implements,

original: mahākośakoṣṭāgārāṇi ca paripūrṇāni /
analyzed: mahā kośa koṣṭāgārāṇi ca paripūrṇāni
translated: and that the great treasuries and storehouses were completely full.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca vismito hṛṣṭaḥ santuṣṭaḥ udagra āttamanā pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajāto yena bhagavāṃstena upasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca vismitaḥ hṛṣṭaḥ santuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manā pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Having seen this, he was amazed, delighted, satisfied, uplifted, overjoyed, and filled with joy and happiness. He approached the Blessed One,

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivaṃdya bhagavantametadavocat /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivaṃdya bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: and having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and said this to the Blessed One:

original: ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo 'sya yena sucandro gṛhapatirmahādhano mahābhogo mahākośakoṣṭāgāraḥ sarvadhanadhānyasamṛddhaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ sya yena sucandraḥ gṛhapatiḥ mahādhanaḥ mahā bhogaḥ mahā kośa koṣṭāgāraḥ sarva dhana dhānya samṛddhaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: What is the cause, Blessed One, what is the condition, by which the householder Sucandra became greatly wealthy, greatly prosperous, with a great treasury and granary, and abundant with all wealth and grain?

original: bhagavānāha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: śrāddhānaṃda sucandragṛhapatiḥ paramaśrāddhaḥ kalyāṇāśayaḥ /
analyzed: śrāddhānaṃda sucandra gṛhapatiḥ parama śrāddhaḥ kalyāṇa āśayaḥ
translated: Ananda, the householder Sucandra was extremely faithful, with a virtuous intention.

original: udgṛhītā ca teneyaṃ vasudhārā nāma dhāriṇī dhāritā vācitā deśitā grāhitā paryavāptā prakīrtitā anumoditā idānīṃ parebhyaśca saṃprakāśayiṣyati

translated: And by him this dhāraṇī called Vasudhārā was taken up, recited, taught, received, mastered, proclaimed, rejoiced in, and now he will teach it to others.

original: tena cānaṃda tvamapyudgṛhīṣvemāṃ vasudhārā nāma dhāriṇīṃ dhāraya vācaya deśaya grāhaya paryavāpnuhi pravarttaya prakīrtaya anumodaya parebhyaśca

translated: And by you, Ananda, this dhāraṇī called Vasudhārā should be taken up, borne, recited, taught, received, mastered, propagated, proclaimed, rejoiced in, and to others

original: vistareṇa saṃprakāśaya /
analyzed: vistareṇa saṃprakāśaya
translated: should be taught in detail.

original: yasyeyaṃ kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā hastagatā gṛhagatā pustakagatā bhaviṣyati
analyzed: yasya iyam kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā hasta gatā gṛha gatā pustaka gatā bhaviṣyati
translated: For whomsoever, son of good family or daughter of good family, this (dhāraṇī) will be in hand, in the house, in the book,

original: na tasya rogadurbhikṣamarakakāṃtārādayo bhaviṣyanti krameṇa vibhavāstasya pravardhiṣyanti
analyzed: na tasya roga durbhikṣa maraka kāṃtāra ādayaḥ bhaviṣyanti krameṇa vibhavāḥ tasya pravardhiṣyanti
translated: for him there will be no diseases, famines, epidemics, or calamities. Gradually his wealth will increase.

original: tad bhaviṣyati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāyai mahato janakāyasyārthāya
analyzed: tat bhaviṣyati bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāyai mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya
translated: That will be for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of a great multitude of people,

original: sukhāya devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca /
analyzed: sukhāya devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca
translated: of gods and humans.

original: nāhaṃ ānaṃda taṃ dharme samanupaśyāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake saśramaṇabrāhmaṇikāyāṃ
analyzed: na aham ānanda tam dharme samanupaśyāmi sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sa śramaṇa brāhmaṇikāyām
translated: Ānanda, I do not see that person in this world with its gods, Māras, Brahmās, renunciants, and brahmins,

original: prajāyāṃ sadevamānuṣāsurāyāṃ ca imāṃ vasudhārā nāma dhāriṇīṃ mahāvidyāṃ anyathā kariṣyati
analyzed: prajāyām sa deva mānuṣa asurāyām ca imām vasudhārā nāma dhāriṇīm mahāvidyām anyathā kariṣyati
translated: in this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans, who could act contrary to this dhāraṇī called Vasudhā, this great knowledge,

original: atikramiṣyati vā naitatsthānaṃ vidyate /
analyzed: atikramiṣyati vā na etat sthānam vidyate
translated: or transgress it. There is no such possibility.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: abhedyā hyete ānaṃda vasudhārādhāriṇīmantrā na vaite kṣīṇakuśalamūlānāṃ sattvānāṃ śrutipathamapyāgamiṣyanti kaḥ punarvādo pustakagatāmapi
analyzed: abhedyāḥ hi ete ānaṃda vasudhārādhāriṇī mantrāḥ na vā ete kṣīṇa kuśala mūlānām sattvānām śrutipatham api āgamiṣyanti kaḥ punar pustaka gatām api
translated: Ānanda, these Vasudhā dhāraṇī mantras are unbreakable. They will not even come to the ears of beings with exhausted roots of virtue, let alone be in a book

original: kṛtvā gṛhe Vdh
analyzed: kṛtvā gṛhe
translated: and be kept in the house.

original: dhārayiṣyanti /
analyzed: dhārayiṣyanti
translated: They will be held.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

translated: and by all evil fears.

translated: Ānanda said, Blessed One, I have received this dhāraṇī called Vasudhārā, I have upheld it, recited it, grasped it, taught it, propagated it, proclaimed it, rejoiced in it, and well contemplated it in my mind.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān ānaṃda utthāyāsanādekāṃsamuttarāsaṃgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇajānumaṇḍalaṃ
